location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 35/16, 40 Attack on Sohar; Jannabah disturbances at Sur'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged chronologically from the front to the rear of the file.
Foliation: The foliation system in use is the sequence of numbers appearing in the top right hand corner of each folio.

mods.abstract: Correspondence in this file discusses:The attack on Sohar in 1895 by Sa'ud bin Azzan [Saʻūd bin ʻAzzān]. Includes printed record of correspondence between the Political Resident, Persian Gulf and the Foreign Secretary to the Government of India; translation of a letter from the Wali of Sohar to the Sultan of Muscat (Fayṣal bin Turkī).Disturbances by the Jannabah tribe at Sur in 1898.A visit of the French gunboat Scorpionin 1898 and the intrigues of Monsieur Ottavi the French Consul and intrigues relating to the appointment of Wazirs to the Sultan.Correspondence is mainly between Major Christopher George Forbes Fagan, Political Agent, Muscat and the Political Resident Persian Gulf.
